body.name: Mompush Lithe V2 Lightweight Stroller + Snack Tray, Ultra-Compact Fold & Airplane Ready Travel Stroller, Near Flat Recline Seat, Cup Holder, Raincover & Travelbag Included
features: 175° NEAR-FLAT RECLINE - Fully reclining backrest and adjustable footrest providing a lie flat mode that is perfect for newborns. 3-Position reclining backrest with easy one-hand adjustment.

KEEP IT LIGHT - Ultra-lightweight at under 15 lbs, allowing you to effortlessly navigate the world. We've upgraded the folding carry mechanism to a carry handlebar, elevating the user experience and simplifying storage, whether in your car's trunk or a discreet home corner.
ONE SECOND FOLD – One-handed, one step fold for on-the-go convenience. Fit into most overhead airplane bins. Travel bag included for traveling and carrying stroller with ease.

MAXIMUM PROTECTION –The large UPF 50+ canopy provides complete shade protection from harmful UV rays, while the extendable mesh ventilation panel ensures better air flow. Included rain shield to keep baby dry.
BUILT-IN TRAY - Features a detachable child tray, provides a durable, easy-to-clean surface for your child's snacks and drinks, keep baby satisfied while strolling. Tray folds with the stroller.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Lithe V2 | Stroll and snack with ease Small in size but big on comfort. Ultra-lightweight and super compact Lithe V2 is airplane friendly and adventure ready.
- The Snack Tray and Cup Holder accessories easily attach to the Lithe V2 for added convenience and comfort. - Newborn nest mode: seat lies fully flat for easier, comfier naptimes for newborn baby.

Maximum Protection The large, expandable canopy made of UPF 50+ fabric provides complete shade protection from harmful UV rays. Mesh Ventilation Panel Designed a mesh ventilation panel allows air to circulate and provides a quite expansive view of what your child is doing. Smooth Strolling Shock-absorbing, all-wheel suspension ensures a comfortable ride for both you and baby. Travel Carry Bag Included Lithe comes complete with a tailored rain cover and water-resistant travel carry bag to protect your stroller on the go.

Mompush Family Lightweight Stroller Type 2-in-1 compact 17.3 lbs Product Weight 23.2 lbs 28 x 21.3 x 13.4 in Folded Dimensions 43.4 x 24 x 14.2 in Newborn Nest Infant Bassinet Mode Integrated carrycot Adjustable Handlebar Adjustable Footrest Accept Car Seats Lightweight Stroller Type 2-in-1 luxury 17.3 lbs Product Weight 22.7 lbs 28 x 21.3 x 13.4 in Folded Dimensions 33.9 x 25 x 16.7 in Newborn Nest Infant Bassinet Mode Integrated carrycot Adjustable Handlebar Adjustable Footrest Accept Car Seats Lightweight Stroller Type Full size 17.3 lbs Product Weight 24.8 lbs 28 x 21.3 x 13.4 in Folded Dimensions 34 x 23.6 x 15.4 in Newborn Nest Infant Bassinet Mode Individual bassinet Adjustable Handlebar Adjustable Footrest Accept Car Seats Lightweight Stroller Type All terrain 17.3 lbs Product Weight 23.6 lbs 28 x 21.3 x 13.4 in Folded Dimensions 31.5 x 22 x 13.7 in Newborn Nest Infant Bassinet Mode Lie flat mode Adjustable Handlebar Adjustable Footrest Accept Car Seats

What's the specifications? -Accommodate littles from the newborn stage up through 40 pounds -Unfolded: 23.23″ L x 21.2″ W x 40.55″ H -Folded (with Snack Tray): 13.4" L x 21.3″ W x 28″ H What's included? Stroller + Snack Tray + Cup Holder +Rain Cover + Carry Bag How to set the Newborn Nest? While it’s reclined you can also bring up the footrest and tucked underneath as additional siding that can be snapped to the sides of the seat and effectively create a bassinet. What's the difference between Lithe V1 and V2? The Lithe V2 designed with the one-handed, simple mechanism recline and truly achieved real 175° lie flat mode for newborn baby. In additon, V2 also comes with a brand new detachable snack tray.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I did weeks of researching which stroller would be perfect for my infant for our travel. I wanted to have a comfortable and light weight one. I’ve read a lot of great reviews about this stroller so I decided to order it. It has a lot of good features. Lightweight- so easy to carry, and easy to maneuver. The multi-position backrest, the almost flat backrest is my favorite because my baby can sleep comfortably which you can’t find in other strollers. The extra extending canopy is a great help especially when walking during sunny days. The snack tray is a plus. Other lightweight strollers don’t have snack trays. It also came with a rain cover, a cupholder, and a carrying bag. The wheels provide a smooth ride. It is also easy to fold and unfold with just one hand and it is very compact, it doesn’t require large space for storage and it stands on its own when folded. Overall I am so excited to use it not only for traveling but also for everyday use.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect Travel Stroller
reviews.reviewText: We have a 1 year old- he’s a big boy. This was the perfect stroller for travel. Price is reasonable and way cheaper than our original stroller. At 18lbs it’s light enough to whip around the airport and ride up to the gate. We took it on a 2 week road trip and it handles so well. It fit in the trunk but also fits he front seat floor area. It has a bag and a rain cover which is so nice not having to buy extra accessories. Folding is super easy. (Grandpa had to watch a YouTube video how to fold our big cybex stroller lol) It also turns into a bassinet which is so cool and reclines. When our kid is sitting upright it fits my bag above his head so I don’t have to carry everything. The bottom doesn’t hold much but but a small bag but the fact I can throw my bag in the upper area for easy reach was great. Cup holder is a plus. And the snack tray….. the best part. Not many strollers have it and my guy loves snacks and reaching in the cup holders playing with his sippie cup.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Finally found a travel stroller with all the things I wanted!
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. I was looking for a lightweight travel stroller but also wanted it to function as an every day stroller. This I think is gonna be it. The only reason I’m giving it a 4 star right now is because I haven’t actually used it yet but I’m excited about finding one with all the features I wanted.It has a cup holder for parent, a large extendable canopy, seat sits all the way up for toddlers or lays all the way down for napping kiddos of all ages, the foot rest that can go up or down depending on the size of your kiddo and leg rest needed, a snack tray that’s removable, a cover that comes out that can cover the legs to help block from wind or cool temps, a decent size basket underneath for storage, all wheel drive on the front, collapses up pretty small that it would fit most overhead compartments on a plane, has extendable handle if you want to wheel it through the airport, nice travel bag, and rain cover. I didn’t ask for much outa my stroller I wanted right? 🤷‍♀️ lol … this covered all the basics for sure and more… excited to use it and see how well it does at Disney World cause it can occasionally be mass packed house chaos at that place.And not to mention I got all these things at what I feel like is a pretty good price point… it goes on a good sale every now and then so if you’re thinking about purchasing it put it in your notifications for the price drop.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very impressive little stroller!
reviews.reviewText: Soooo glad we decided to go with this, it's really impressive and well designed with lots of thoughtful things that are really helpful!! We bought this to go on a cruise and couldn't fathom taking our big Graco contraption. Now we're only using this! The bassinet portion is really helpful (if your kid naps or for changing diapers when you don't have anywhere else to change them). I love the handy extra storage hammock it makes up top when the seat is all the way forward. It is light and folds up small (can sometimes take a little jiggling but mostly easy to fold and unfold) the carry case was amazing for the plane and big enough to put other things in too. It is easy to maneuver, love the built in snack and cup tray on the front and so many other things. It's made so thoughtfully and so far we've been loving it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for travel
reviews.reviewText: Bought this to travel with instead of using my Nuna (didn’t want the airport to damage it). We used it on a Disney cruise and didn’t have an issue navigating the halls or entering the state room. This stroller has a lot of convenient features including the ability to lay flat, sunshade, cup holder, and snack tray. It collapses pretty quickly. It also has a carrying bag and a rain cover. The only cons I have: the fabric feels cheap (compared to Nuna) and the storage basket is rather small. If you’re trying to save money, I’d skip the Nuna and get this mompush instead. Save the $$

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Cheaply made for the price
reviews.reviewText: Pretty sure mine is refurbished as the snack tray has several scratches. I like some of the features such as an almost full recline so my daughter can nap better in the stroller. I wanted something lightweight as well which this stroller has both features but for price, everything is so cheap feeling and the stroller isn’t sturdy at all compared to my powerglyde.Pros: lightweight, folds up small for storage, full reclineCons: cheaply made, no peek-a-boo window as advertised (it’s even in my instruction manual), bassinet feature is terrible, super small storage underneath, “adjustable” door foot rest is either all the way up or all the way down, I’m 5”0 and think the handle bar is low for me so tall people beware, hard to fold up (have to slide a button and squeeze another in at the same time)Overall, if it was under $100 I would say it’s not bad but for the price, it’s extremely cheaply made. I wish I kept my Jeep powerglyde stroller

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My daughter loves it!
reviews.reviewText: This is such an awesome stroller. Very modular, lightweight, and very durable so far. It has a smooth ride with a firm and strong locking mechanism for the rear wheels. It folds up into a very compact package that could easily fit in any trunk with space to spare. The included rain guard is an awesome bonus.My only complaint is the locking mechanism on the handle. It feels pretty cheap and can be unresponsive at times, mine wore in a little after several weeks of use so hopefully it will continue to improve.
Práctica y funcional, buenos materiales resistentesRealmente la recomiendo

Todavía no la use, me acaba de llegar y me encantó! tiene muchos detalles inteligentes, bonitos, útiles, y prácticos así como lo quería. Lamentablemente la espalda es corta, debería medir al menos 10 cm mas o tener un expansión para que los niños mas alto caben bien
Mi bebé tiene 6 meses y apenas le queda un poco de espacio en la altura total del asiento por lo que no me va a durar ni al año . La regrese
